Contributor: Annison, Edward S., artist.; Liberty Loan Committee.;
Note: Signed "Edward S. Annison." Date based on America's participation in the war. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Design for a newspaper and magazine advertisement for a Liberty Loan campaign.  The text explains that the dollars from the Liberty bonds go for rifles, bullets and machine guns. The more dollars raised from Liberty bonds and turned into munitions "the sooner the Prussian plague will be wiped out."  The illustration shows men working in a industrial plant making bullets.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I

Title: Making dollars into munitions
